CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. 5, reads: "Storybook Artist Is Favorite With Children - The story-book artist for scores of children at the West End Branch of the Carnegie Library is 35-year-old Theodore Hamiel. Responding to the request of Miss Patricia Hays (top left photo), who had discovered his talents, Mr. Hamiel has been painting story-book characters, like those in top left photo.  His work has greatly enlivened interest in a weekly story telling hour. In the other photos, Mr. Hamiel is shown with some of his other paintings which he explains as "just puttering around in paint." - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Patricia Hays holding "Robinson Crusoe" and artist Theodore Hamiel holding painter's pallet, standing before cabinets with storybook character paintings, in West End branch, Carnegie Library
